member.summary: Divide a value (numerator) by a segment value (denominator) to get segments of as equal size as possible.
member.remarks: from: http://stackoverflow.com/a/577451/31567 This doesn't try to cope with negative numbers :).

member.summary: Divide a value (numerator) by a segment value (denominator) to get segments of exactly denominator in size, and the leftovers at the end.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Sample Rate in hertz. stream:sample_rate.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.AudioUtilityInfo.BitsPerSecond
member.summary: Gets or sets the bits per second (bits/second). format:bit_rate. NOTE: this is the format bit rate which includes the header. For very short files this will be signficantly different from the theoretical bit rate because averaging the value over many seconds will eventually smooth out the extra bits in the first frame so that the average bit rate approaches the theoretical bit rate.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bits per sample.

member.name: M:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.CustomSpectrogramUtility.InvokeDotNetFft(System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: This .NET FFT library was downloaded from http://www.mathdotnet.com/Iridium.aspx. The documentation and various examples of code are available at http://www.mathdotnet.com/doc/IridiumFFT.ashx.

member.name: M:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.CustomSpectrogramUtility.DecibelSpectra(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts spectral amplitudes directly to dB, normalising for window power and sample rate. NOTE 1: The window contributes power to the signal which must subsequently be removed from the spectral power. NOTE 2: Spectral power must be normaliesd for sample rate. Effectively calculate freq power per sample. NOTE 3: The power in all freq bins except f=0 must be doubled because the power spectrum is an even function about f=0; This is due to the fact that the spectrum actually consists of 512 + 1 values, the centre value being for f=0. NOTE 4: The decibels value is a ratio. Here the ratio is implied. dB = 10*log(amplitude ^2) but in this method adjust power to account for power of Hamming window and SR. NOTE 5: THIS METHOD ASSUMES THAT THE LAST BIN IS THE NYQUIST FREQ BIN.
member.param: to normalise for the sampling rate.
small value to avoid log of zero.

member.name: M:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.CustomSpectrogramUtility.CalculateModalNoise(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary:
Calculates the modal noise value for each freq bin. Does so using a series of overlapped matrices. TODO!!!! COULD SIMPLY THIS METHOD. JUST CALCULATE MODE FOR EACH FREQ BIN WITHOUT OVERLAP .... .... AND THEN APPLY MORE SEVERE SMOOTHING TO THE MODAL NOISE PROFILE IN PREVIOUS METHOD.
COMPARE THIS METHOD WITH SNR.SubtractModalNoise().

member.summary: returns the min and max values in a matrix of doubles.

member.summary: Returns the submatrix of passed matrix. Assume that r1 less than r2, c1 less than c2. Row, column indices start at 0.

member.name: T:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality
member.summary: Resample quality.

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality.Quick
member.summary: q bandwidth: n/a Rej dB: ~30 @ Fs/4 Typical Use: playback on ancient hardware.

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality.Low
member.summary: l bandwidth: 80% Rej dB: 100 Typical Use: playback on old hardware.

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality.Medium
member.summary: m bandwidth: 95% Rej dB: 100 Typical Use: audio playback.

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality.High
member.summary: h bandwidth: 125 Rej dB: 125 Typical Use: 16-bit mastering (use with dither).

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Audio.SoxAudioUtility.SoxResampleQuality.VeryHigh
member.summary: v bandwidth: 95% Rej dB: 175 Typical Use: 24-bit mastering.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This method assumes channel samples are interleaved!.
member.param: The raw data with interleaved samples from each channel.

member.name: T:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat
member.summary: Common Wave Compression Codes Code Description ------------------------------------------- 0 (0x0000) Unknown 1 (0x0001) PCM/uncompressed 2 (0x0002) Microsoft ADPCM 3 (0x0003) PCM data in IEEE floating-point format. 6 (0x0006) ITU G.711 a-law 7 (0x0007) ITU G.711 -law 17 (0x0011) IMA ADPCM 20 (0x0016) ITU G.723 ADPCM (Yamaha) 49 (0x0031) GSM 6.10 64 (0x0040) ITU G.721 ADPCM 80 (0x0050) MPEG 65,534 (0xFFFE) WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE 65,535 (0xFFFF) Experimental.

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_PCM
member.summary: PCM/uncompressed

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_ADPCM
member.summary: Microsoft ADPCM

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_IEEE_FLOAT
member.summary: IEEE Float

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_ALAW
member.summary: 8-bit ITU-T G.711 A-law

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_MULAW
member.summary: 8-bit ITU-T G.711 -law

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE
member.summary: Determined by SubFormat

member.name: F:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.WaveFormat.WAVE_FORMAT_EXPERIMENTAL
member.summary: Experimental

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets or sets BitsPerSample as if were a single channel.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.BlockAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets BlockAlign - the number of bytes in each sample for all channels.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.BlockCount
member.summary: Gets BlockCount - the number of blocks of data (each channel has one sample). Defined in http://www-mmsp.ece.mcgill.ca/documents/audioformats/wave/wave.html.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Channels
member.summary: Gets or sets Channels.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Epsilon
member.summary: Gets the Epsilon (smallest distinguishable value) for this format.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.ExactDurationSeconds
member.summary: Gets the ExactDurationSeconds of the data. This calculation should be accurate down to the nanosecond. Note this is a new value and SHOULD NOT be used for any real calculations.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Length
member.summary: Gets the total number of samples for each channel. An alias for BlockCount.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.SampleRate
member.summary: Gets or sets SampleRate.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Samples
member.summary: Gets the samples.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Time
member.summary: Gets Time - the duration of the data. NOTE: this value has been rounded to the nearest millisecond! See for a precise value.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.ValidBitsPerSample
member.summary: Gets ValidBitsPerSample. Only set when Format is WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE. wValidBitsPerSample specifies the precision of the sample in bits.

member.name: P:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets values from samples.
member.returns: A sample for the selected index and channel.

member.name: M:Acoustics.Tools.Wav.WavReader.CalculateEpsilonForRescaledInteger(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the smallest possible representable value for an integer of size bitDepth hat has been rescaled to the range [-1,1].
member.param: The bit depth of the integer the range was represented in before rescaling.
member.returns: The smallest distinguishable value for data that was stored as an integer before rescaling.
